dismissalText.commentary: Khaya Zondo c Pandya b Chahal 54 (74b 3x4 2x6 119m) SR: 72.97

dismissalComment.html: Chahal hangs this legbreak up in the air and gets it to drop down outside off. Zondo, having made room by skipping outside leg, drives inside-out but can't elevate the shot over Pandya at deep cover. India's wristspinners are at it again

dismissalText.commentary: Andile Phehlukwayo c & b Thakur 34 (42b 2x4 2x6 64m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: Thakur has Andile chipping a return catch. Full and around off stump, possibly a knuckle ball, Andile aims to work it to the leg side. Instead, he leading-edges it back to Thakur. He bags four wickets on return

headshotImage.caption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: HM Amla headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: HM Amla headshot

dismissalComment.html: Thakur has Amla strangled down the leg side Dug in short and angling down the leg side, Amla can't quite control the pull because of the line. And he is late onto the shot. He would have been better off had he left it alone. Instead, he gloves it behind to Dhoni. Thakur roars "come on" and celebrates a wicket on return

headshotImage.caption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Aiden Markram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Thakur strikes again, this time with the slower offcutter. Thakur's Mumbai team-mate Iyer claims an outstanding overhead catch. He hangs on even as he tumbles onto the ground. Pitched up outside off, the change of pace does the SA captain in. He plays a long way in front of his body and scoops a drive to cover. Great catch from Iyer after the drops earlier in the series. Perfect way for India to round out the Powerplay

headshotImage.caption: F Behardien headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: F Behardien headshot

dismissalComment.html: that's a ripper at deep third man! Jasprit Bumrah, take a bow! He's not among the safest hands in the Indian line-up, but he responds to this upper cut from Behardien well enough, sprinting to his right, keeping his eyes on the ball, diving to get to it, and then it just sticks in his right hand. Lucky break for India (not that they really needed it)

headshotImage.caption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: scoops a good low catch at short cover and Kohli comes up with a little gesture at the batsman, the finger on his lips. Good bowling from Bumrah, on a slow pitch, he dishes out the offcutter. The length is full, the line is just that tiny bit wide of off stump to draw the batsman into a drive. Klaasen hits it straight at the fielder

headshotImage.caption: Imran Tahir headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Imran Tahir headshot

dismissalComment.html: Tahir has the tendency to stay leg-side of the ball. This is pitched up on middle, Tahir stays leg-side of the ball, both feet inside the crease, he winds up reaching out for the ball with his hands and scoops a drive to Kohli at short cover. And that's Kohli's 100th catch in ODIs

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris c Dhawan b Kuldeep Yadav 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Kuldeep adds his name into the wickets column with a wrong'un. The wristspinner has Morris holing out to long-off, where Dhawan pouches it safely and slaps his thigh in celebration. Tossed up liberally around off and breaks away. Morris looks to slug the googly away - against the break. He can't get underneath this very full one either. All he can do is to skew a catch to Dhawan in the deep via a leading edge

dismissalComment.html: top-edges the pull and Klaasen takes the offering gleefully! Rohit thinks the shot is on because the line is on leg stump, and his intention is to only help it to fine leg. But Ngidi generates extra bounce by hitting the deck and provides South Africa with a massive breakthrough. Also, the ball is only 126 kph, so the miscue doesn't really travel too far

commentTextItems.html: There it is! India win the series 5-1. Tahir loops it full and outside off, Kohli sizes it up and crunnnnches a drive to the left of Tahir. He holds the pose. Regal shot. Regal innings. Regal chase

commentPostTextItems.html: 8pm The victorious India team poses with the series trophy. Nikhil Kalro's report will tell you the full story of the day. This is Deivarayan Muthu and Alagappan Muthu signing off.
A reminder that viewers in the Indian subcontinent can catch all the highlights of this match here.

7.35pm Virat Kohli who has moved past AB de Villiers shakes hands with his good mate. He bossed the chase with his 35th ODI hundred and fourth of the tour. This win, however, was set up the bowlers. Thakur, playing his first game of the series, bagged four wickets and exposed South Africa's fragile middle order. The wristspinners - Kuldeep and Chahal - managed just three wickets between them but there would be no way back for South Africa. This despite Zondo's maiden international fifty on a slower-than-usual Centurion pitch. The margin of series defeat has thrown up questions about South Africa's depth. Can Markram hold his place when the big guns are back? Are Duminy and Miller still good enough? How does this shake up their 2019 World Cup plans?
WATCH - The Kohli straight drive to seal the series (Available in the Indian subcontinent).

Markram: It was quite a tough series. It's something we have to look back at it with a lot of thought and try to figure out why we weren't as good as we could be. They cashed in and that's where we lacked. It's how we grow and learn. We will try to take some positives. It's a nice break away from the format. It's not a bad thing for us.

Kohli, Man of the match and Man of the Series: It was a day where I felt really good. Last game, I was not in the right kind of mindset. This is a beautiful place to bat under lights. That's the idea behind bowling first. I like setting up for the short ball. It was a blessing in disguise, and they kept bowling short. I think the pitch got better to bat on under lights. It has been a rollercoaster till now. People who are close to me deserve a lot of credit. My wife has kept me going throughout the tour. I am grateful for that. Obviously, you want to lead from the front, and that's a wonderful feeling. I have got eight or nine years left in my career and I want to make the most of every day. It's a blessing that I am healthy and getting to captain my country. They have shown great character - especially the two young spinners. Shikhar at the top, Rohit. The way the series went augurs well for us. We're looking forward to the T20s. The tour is not over yet. As a team, we felt we did not play with the right frame of mind in the first two Tests. Come Johannesburg, we made up our mind that we will not take a backward step. After losing the Test series, I was talking to you. I am here taking to you after winning the ODI series.

commentPreTextItems.html: Sundar S: "I think Markram will hang on to his place when Faf gets back. But it is Duminy and Miller who need to be dropped. Duminy for sure. I believe his SA time is up."

commentTextItems.html: back of a length and outside off, Rahane manufactures more swinging room by jumping outside the leg stump. He wallops the ball through the covers

dismissalComment.html: Thakur strikes again, this time with the slower offcutter. Thakur's Mumbai team-mate Iyer claims an outstanding overhead catch. He hangs on even as he tumbles onto the ground. Pitched up outside off, the change of pace does the SA captain in. He plays a long way in front of his body and scoops a drive to cover. Great catch from Iyer after the drops earlier in the series. Perfect way for India to round out the Powerplay

dismissalText.commentary: Khaya Zondo c Pandya b Chahal 54 (74b 3x4 2x6 119m) SR: 72.97

dismissalText.commentary: Heinrich Klaasen c Kohli b Bumrah 22 (40b 3x4 0x6 38m) SR: 55

dismissalComment.html: scoops a good low catch at short cover and Kohli comes up with a little gesture at the batsman, the finger on his lips. Good bowling from Bumrah, on a slow pitch, he dishes out the offcutter. The length is full, the line is just that tiny bit wide of off stump to draw the batsman into a drive. Klaasen hits it straight at the fielder

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Bumrah b Thakur 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: that's a ripper at deep third man! Jasprit Bumrah, take a bow! He's not among the safest hands in the Indian line-up, but he responds to this upper cut from Behardien well enough, sprinting to his right, keeping his eyes on the ball, diving to get to it, and then it just sticks in his right hand. Lucky break for India (not that they really needed it)

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Morris c Dhawan b Kuldeep Yadav 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Kuldeep adds his name into the wickets column with a wrong'un. The wristspinner has Morris holing out to long-off, where Dhawan pouches it safely and slaps his thigh in celebration. Tossed up liberally around off and breaks away. Morris looks to slug the googly away - against the break. He can't get underneath this very full one either. All he can do is to skew a catch to Dhawan in the deep via a leading edge

dismissalText.commentary: Andile Phehlukwayo c & b Thakur 34 (42b 2x4 2x6 64m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: Thakur has Andile chipping a return catch. Full and around off stump, possibly a knuckle ball, Andile aims to work it to the leg side. Instead, he leading-edges it back to Thakur. He bags four wickets on return

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c Zondo b Ngidi 18 (34b 2x4 0x6 56m) SR: 52.94

dismissalComment.html: smacks it straight to point! It's there for the cut. And the cut comes out, with plenty of power. So much that Zondo ends up having the juggle the ball. But all is well and South Africa have their second wicket

headshotImage.caption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Heinrich Klaasen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma c †Klaasen b Ngidi 15 (13b 3x4 0x6 14m) SR: 115.38

dismissalComment.html: top-edges the pull and Klaasen takes the offering gleefully! Rohit thinks the shot is on because the line is on leg stump, and his intention is to only help it to fine leg. But Ngidi generates extra bounce by hitting the deck and provides South Africa with a massive breakthrough. Also, the ball is only 126 kph, so the miscue doesn't really travel too far

stories.title: Markram wasn't the right choice as captain - Graeme Smith
stories.subTitle: India in South Africa 2017-18
stories.seoTitle: Markram wasn't the right choice as captain - Graeme Smith
stories.summary: Taking nothing away from the young captain, Graeme Smith said South Africa could have looked at JP Duminy, Hashim Amla or AB de Villiers to stand in as captain for the ODIs

image.caption: Aiden Markram fell for 32
image.longCaption: Aiden Markram fell for 32, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: Freed-up Kohli shows what he is truly capable of
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 6th ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Sidharth Monga: Freed-up Virat Kohli shows what he is truly capable of
stories.summary: Earlier in the one-day series, the India captain batted according to the match situation, did just what his team needed. Now, with the result of the game holding little value, he had the licence to let himself go, and boy did he put on a show

image.caption: Virat Kohli is jubilant upon sealing the maiden bilateral ODI series win in South Africa
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli is jubilant upon sealing the maiden bilateral ODI series win in South Africa, South Africa v India, 5th ODI, Port Elizabeth, February 13, 2018

stories.title: In defeat, Markram remains optimistic about the future
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 6th ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: In defeat, Aiden Markram remains optimistic about the future
stories.summary: South Africa's young captain says he is richer for the experience gained in this series, and thinks the lopsided result will spur his team on and make future victories that much sweeter

image.caption: Aiden Markram and Kagiso Rabada celebrate the dismissal of Shikhar Dhawan
image.longCaption: Aiden Markram and Kagiso Rabada celebrate the dismissal of Shikhar Dhawan, South Africa v India, 5th ODI, Port Elizabeth, February 13, 2018

stories.title: Kohli's 35th ODI ton helps India wallop South Africa 5-1
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 6th ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Virat Kohli's 35th ODI ton helps India wallop South Africa 5-1
stories.summary: Shardul Thakur dominated with the ball, Virat Kohli with the bat and India cruised to an eight-wicket win in Centurion, taking the six-match series 5-1

image.caption: Virat Kohli celebrates his 35th ODI hundred
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli celebrates his 35th ODI hundred, South Africa v India, 6th ODI, Centurion, February 16, 2018

stories.title: Markram braces for another trial in captaincy run
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 6th ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Sidharth Monga: Aiden Markram braces for another trial in captaincy run
stories.summary: Before the ODI series began, Aiden Markram wasn't even sure of a place in the side, but in the span of five matches, he has gone from being touted a future captain to now battling for a permanent spot after SA return to full strength

image.caption: Aiden Markram fell for 32
image.longCaption: Aiden Markram fell for 32, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town, February 7, 2018

stories.title: Back to Centurion, but for a dead rubber
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 6th ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Back to Centurion, but for a dead rubber
stories.summary: The game will be a chance to rest players like Jasprit Bumrah and Kagiso Rabada although South Africa should be more desperate for a face-saving win than India's quest for 5-1

image.caption: Rohit Sharma sets off for a run as JP Duminy fails to stop a ball off his own bowling
image.longCaption: Rohit Sharma sets off for a run as JP Duminy fails to stop a ball off his own bowling, South Africa v India, 5th ODI, Port Elizabeth, February 13, 2018

videos.summary: Daryll Cullinan feels there are no quick fixes against India's Kuldeep Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal as he looks ahead to the sixth ODI
